website_summaries.verdict: Though it's not ideal for everyone, it's a great pick for women who prefer a reasonably lightweight model that's made with their comfort needs in mind.
pros: This affordable backpack's streamlined design is made to accommodate women's body structures more precisely for a comfortable fit
Has a 15-inch laptop sleeve and several pockets for small items
cons: At 26 liters, the items you can stuff into it will be limited compared to larger models
Some seams on the straps have been known to come loose

customer_reviews.title: ... for the past three-plus years and it is the best backpack I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I've used this bag everyday for the past three-plus years and it is the best backpack I've ever owned. It's water resistant which has saved my laptop more than once, the cloth hasn't faded from years of use, and the bottom isn't worn through even though I regularly carry around my laptop, planner, and several notebooks/books. The Jester's design is practical and also sleek enough that I feel fine taking it to professional conferences. There's a sleeve that's the perfect size for a laptop or folders, and a bunch of handy compartments. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: mmvroom

customer_reviews.title: Well designed backpack
customer_reviews.text: I chose to buy this backpack because I liked its style and wanted a backpack with two mesh pockets. It's a medium-sized backpack with a laptop pocket that will fit a small laptop. I think the padding on the back and straps is comfortable. In moderate rain, water beads up on the fabric and nothing on the inside gets wet. I haven't had the backpack long enough to know how it fares in snow or heavy rain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love the colors of this backpack as well as its ...
customer_reviews.text: I love the colors of this backpack as well as its sturdiness. It gives good support to my back and seems to be made well. My frustration is that it hardly holds any books. I am in college and am used to carrying a lot of books. I can prob fit 1 binder (2 incher) and 2 books and try to cram my laptop in there. Usually, in most back packs, I can carry like 5 books. Plus, the drink holder seems small and it was hard putting a drink in there.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Begetti

customer_reviews.title: Great little pack
customer_reviews.text: Great little pack! It's perfect for day trips and if I pack conservatively it's big enough for an overnight. I think it might even be small enough to fit under the seat on a plane so I could possibly get away with 2 bags when flying.
customer_reviews.author: MeganM

customer_reviews.title: Best Backpack for daily use
customer_reviews.text: This is the best backpack I have ever owned. It is not too large. My laptop slides easily in the protective pouch, and the rigid back keeps the shape of the backpack and makes it easy to carry. The colors are fun. I wish the pencil pouches were on the opposite side of the flap (they are on the interior wall of the large opening). but that is a small thing that is easily overlooked based on all the other great features of this bag.
customer_reviews.author: tess

customer_reviews.title: Cute and functional. Wish it would stop falling forward
customer_reviews.text: I got the light heather grey/orange color. Super cute - All metal parts (like zipper pulls) are a matte silver finish, which makes the backpack look expensive and stylish. Good water resistance - Kept all my stuff inside dry after being in a light rain for 4 hours. Only complaint - When not being carried, this pack does NOT stand up, keeps falling forward, which is quite annoying. I have to either hang it or put it face up
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for students/weekend adventurers
customer_reviews.text: I've used this backpack for everyday class-to-class purposes and for short backcountry adventures. It's a nice size and very lightweight. I can only fit one three ringed binder in it at a time, which is OK because that's all I usually need per class. It can fit a weekend's worth of (outdoor) clothing in it as well, as a nice ultralight backpacking option. Beautiful color, and overall well made product. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Emma Young

customer_reviews.title: Moonlight blue heather/coral
customer_reviews.text: I really like this backpack! I love all the organization options that my previous one lacked. However, the colors aren't quite what is displayed. Online there is what looks like a grey heather panel in the middle, but in person it is a very light blue denim-like material. I was slightly disappointed because the reason i chose this was because i liked how the grey looked with the blue and coral accents. But i'll keep it because it isn't too bad, and i don't want to wait for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Meg Birky

customer_reviews.title: This is a great backpack in general
customer_reviews.text: This is a great backpack in general, but it's pretty narrow in the inside, which makes it difficult to carry groceries. I can fit my laptop perfectly, but I can't usually fit more than a couple of books with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyne

customer_reviews.title: Love this backpack.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this backpack. It really does fit a woman's shoulders and carries plenty of items for school. My high school student says it fits all of the homework and her laptop. It is worth every single penny.
customer_reviews.author: luv2read

customer_reviews.title: Not for College students
customer_reviews.text: I love the colors, compartments, and durability. I was just a little disappointed in the size. I thought it was bigger. Its just the size of a standard backpack. I won't hold a laptop or anything
customer_reviews.author: Shylo Schboth

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack, wish it had extra compartments for extra ...
customer_reviews.text: Great backpack, wish it had extra compartments for extra organization but for the price and brand I can't complain. I've gotten a lot of compliments on it as well. I love the neutral colors so it feels like it isn't clashing with any of my outfits ever. (unlike a turqoise bag I previously had ha)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: North Face is the best!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter in college. Its sturdy and roomy. The coral color is bright and fun without being obnoxious. My son, also in college, has been using the same North Face backpack since his sophomore year in high school!!! I'll never buy another brand again!

Both bags are holding up great so far and they take a lot of abuse!

It seems like a strong laptop backpack, the laptop area has a strong padding also. Also the size is not big (like some other laptops) for my height (5.3 women).

customer_reviews.title: Made a week at Disney WAY easier!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for our trip to Disney World as a park bag. Was absolutely perfect to carry everything I needed for a family of 4 with two small kids (6 and 3). Best part was that it was ergonomic for a woman’s back- I was able to carry it for 7 straight days with about 15 pounds of stuff for an average of 10 hours/ 20,000 steps. Highly recommend!!!

customer_reviews.title: Great bag

customer_reviews.text: I have had this backpack for 5 mos. My intention was to use this for gym clothes, shoes, water bottle, laptop a few notebooks and my phone. Good new was it fits all of this, albeit snug. It is hard to easily pull out an item I am in need without taking everything out. This is due to the cushion used as built in laptop sleeve. The packpack is a little stiff and will not sit upright on the ground making it difficult to find a place to put your backpack in class or a meeting. The backpack is a pretty color, durable but not functional. My old Jansport (which I am now using again) blows this away.

I am a pre-nursing student soon to be nursing student who usually is carrying a lot of books, notebooks, a laptop, snacks, pencil bag etc.. this carries everything and takes what feels like lbs of weight off my back compared to my previous backpack. There's not much space for multiple books and notebooks with a laptop in there. It also never sits up on it's own because if you use the front compartment for anything, it pulls the backpack forward. Appearance is nice, but honestly not worth the purchase.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Backpack!

Criss-cross rope on exterior is great for holding a lightweight jacket or shoes. Padded shoulder straps and padded back support are amazing. Can hold at least a 15inch laptop. Impressed with quality of the zippers. Suitable for people at least 5 ft or much taller.

product_meta.title: The North Face Women's Jester Backpack
feature_bullets: The updated FlexVent suspension system features a flexible yoke built from custom injection-molded shoulder straps, an unbelievably comfortable padded mesh back panel and a highly breathable lumbar panel for maximum breathability all day long
Women-specific shoulder straps are flexible so they contour to a wide range of women’s body types. Features sternum strap with whistle buckle and comfortable padded top handle.

Large main compartment for books and binders, front compartment with internal organization has an extra padded tablet sleeve, a pendolier and additional secure-zip pockets. Padded laptop sleeve in the main compartment protects your goods from bumps and falls.

Updated front elastic bungee system for external storage, two extended mesh water bottle pockets, reflective bike-light loop, water bottle tabs and shoulder-strap webbing create 360 degrees of reflectivity
Volume 28L, Avg Weight: 1 lb 12.9 oz, Dimensions: 19.25" x 12.5" x 9" (Laptop Sleeve: 11.75" x 13.25"). Fabrics: 600D polyester emboss and print.
